parse.title: He chanted a song of wizardry,

wikitext.*:
{{Incomplete}} {{Unnamed}} [[File:KuraiGeijutsu - And Finrod fell before the Throne.jpg|thumb|''And Finrod fell before the Throne'' by [[:Category:Images by KuraiGeijutsu|Kurai Geijutsu]]]] '''He chanted a song of wizardry,'''{{Cite DTP|id=S QS.19.045}} is the first line of the first out of two poems in the Silmarillion, and is an excerpt for the [[Lay of Leithian]] according to the last line before the poem. It is the battle between Sauron and Finrod Felagund. [[Clamavi De Profundis]] made a song out of it. and added some elvish in-between some of the lines. They titled the song: '''The Battle of Sauron and Finrod Felagund'''. ==Poem excerpt== [[File:Christopher Tolkien - He chanted a song of wizardry,.wav|thumb|left|[[Christopher Tolkien]] reads ''He chanted a song of wizardry,'']]




He chanted a song of wizardry, Of piercing, opening, of treachery, Revealing, uncovering, betraying. Then sudden Felagund there swaying, Sang in a song of staying, Resisting, battling against power, Of secrets kept, strength like a tower, And trust unbroken, freedom, escape; Of changing and shifting shape, Of snares eluded, broken traps, The prison opening, the chain that snaps. ==External Links== *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9eWZCYuYR6s | Clamavi De Profundis's cover The Battle of Sauron and Finrod Felagund] {{references}} [[Category:Poems in The Lays of Beleriand]]
